name: kertish-dos
description: Kertish Object Storage and Cluster Administration CLI

repo.name: kertish-dos
repo.description: Kertish-dos is a simple distributed object storage platform, implements object storage on a single distributed computer cluster, and provides interfaces for file/folder handling. Kertish-dos aims primarily for completely distributed operation without a single point of failure, scalable to the exabyte level.

readme.summary: Well-structured architecture documentation but severely lacks practical quick-start guides, code examples, and troubleshooting information.
readme.top_issue: No quick-start example or actual API usage code snippets despite being a REST API service - only a theoretical scenario is provided

injection_risks.description: User input is used to construct a string that is then parsed as an integer using strconv.ParseUint. This could potentially lead to unexpected behavior if the user input is not a valid integer.
The version number is printed directly to the console without any validation or sanitization.

critical_findings: Lack of input validation for user-provided data
Potential for error exposure due to default behavior
security.summary: The kertish-dos package has some security concerns, including potential injection risks and lack of input validation, but overall it appears to be a relatively secure system.

common_complaints: lack of documentation for deployment scenarios
sentiment.summary: Project shows signs of minimal maintenance with an open issue from December 2024 unanswered and a 3-year-old closed issue, suggesting low community engagement and slow maintainer response times.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite being on Homebrew
No active contributors in past 6 months
No merged PRs or closed issues in past 6 months
maintenance.summary: The kertish-dos package shows clear signs of abandonment with zero development activity over the past 6 months.

project_metrics.description: Kertish-dos is a simple distributed object storage platform, implements object storage on a single distributed computer cluster, and provides interfaces for file/folder handling. Kertish-dos aims primarily for completely distributed operation without a single point of failure, scalable to the exabyte level.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally well-structured and informative, but lacks a clear quick start guide and troubleshooting section.
concerns: No commits in the past six months
Only one contributor active in the last six months
Docs: Lack of a comprehensive troubleshooting section
Community: request for a new release due to product name change
Security: Lack of input validation for user-provided data
Security: Potential for error exposure due to default behavior
High bus factor risk (100% from top contributor)
highlights: One open issue exists, indicating some level of user engagement or need for updates
